title: Mexico's economy seen growing 0.2% in third quarter
text:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico’s economy is expected to have posted marginal growth in the third quarter, underlining the challenge facing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador as Latin America’s second largest economy fails to pick up steam, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Gross domestic product growth in Latin America’s second largest economy is seen at 0.2% in the third quarter versus the previous three-month period, in seasonally adjusted terms, according to the median forecast of 11 analysts and economists. MXGDQP=ECI
description: Mexico's economy is expected to have posted marginal growth in the third quarter, underlining the challenge facing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador as Latin America's second largest economy fails to pick up steam, a survey showed on Tuesday.
